result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald Benjamin Wilson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Ashland County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Def to report to the DOC in Ashland within 24 hours!
  While on supervision the Def is to pay their financial obligations through the Clerk of Court, which may include payments on restitution, fines, costs, surcharges, etc that are court ordered.
The payments are to be paid directly to the Clerk of Court Office at:
Ashland Co Clerk of Circuit Court
201 Main Street West - Room 307
Ashland, WI  54806
  All financial obligations paid through the Clerk of Courts office are subject to civil judgment and certification to the Department of Revenue on any balance owed after 60 days from entry of judgment.

miscConds.notes: All financial obligations placed on payment plan $75 per month beginning 10/9/17.
Complete individual counseling or group counseling that addresses issues surrounding domestic violence and prevention as directed by the Department of Corrections.

Defendant shall not possess/consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs, drug paraphernalia or any mind altering substances (MAS).  MAS means alcoholic beverages, controlled substances other than those prescribed by treating physician to the Def & taken only as prescribed, inhalants, synthetic marijuana or a similar substance, and/or over-the-counter medications used contrary to label instructions.  THE DEFENDANT IS TO MAINTAIN ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
The Defendant shall not enter any bars, taverns, liquor stores (any place where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol) where mind altering substances are possessed or consumed.
  The Def is subject to random UA testing.
  Any contraband seized to be forfeited!
 
CONTACT with Shannon Bozenik as determined by the Department of Corrections.
  
The Def is to provide a DNA specimen at the Ashland County Jail within 7 days.
Undergo alcohol/drug assessment, to be scheduled within 30 days, and complete recommended treatment-responsible for finding the funding for any treatment/counseling recommended.

Defendant Ronald Benjamin Wilson in court with attorney Kevin Michael Schram.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.17CF67,17CF143,16CM165. Ct rec'd PQ and offer to settle. agreement of the parties. Understands 4 charges and potenial pentalites. PLEADS NC. admits act of domestic abuse. DRI--- 16CM165 count 1, 17CF67 counts 2 and , 17CF143 counts 2 and 3. Signed PQ. understands elements of each crime. Wants Ct to accept pleas of NC.
